thread.title: South Africa's Ramaphosa suspends revenue service head Moyane

title: South Africa's Ramaphosa suspends revenue service head Moyane
text: March 19, 2018 / 9:14 PM / Updated 18 minutes ago South Africa's Ramaphosa suspends revenue service head Moyane   JOHANNESBURG (Reuters) - The head of South Africa’s revenue service (SARS) Tom Moyane was suspended from his job on Monday by President Cyril Ramaphosa with immediate effect pending disciplinary proceedings, a statement from the presidency said. “Developments at the SARS under your leadership have resulted in a deterioration in public confidence in the institution and in public finances being compromised,” Ramaphosa said in the statement. Reporting by Mfuneko Toyana; editing by John Stonestreet
